alert.note: Alert for Ingham (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 05 at 11:54AM EDT until April 09 at 11:00AM EDT by NWS Grand Rapids
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Michigan... Red Cedar River At East Lansing affecting Ingham County. Maple River at Maple Rapids affecting Clinton County. Thornapple River Above Hastings affecting Barry County. .Another round of heavy rain has fallen across Lower Michigan. Rainfall totals in the last 24 hours are around 1.5 inches across the Muskegon and Grand River basins. This will worsen and prolong the high water conditions that many areas are already experiencing, and bring additional locations above flood stage over the next few days. Generally dry weather will prevail through the weekend, so once this water works through the rivers the water levels should finally start to drop. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE SUNDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Red Cedar River At East Lansing. * WHEN...Until late Sunday morning. * IMPACTS...At 8.0 feet, Expect minor flooding of the Michigan State University athletic fields. The Potter Park Zoo parking lot in Lansing begins to flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:30 AM EDT Wednesday the stage was 7.2 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 10:30 AM EDT Wednesday was 7.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 7.7 feet early Friday morning. It will then fall below flood stage late Saturday evening. - Flood stage is 7.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 7.8 feet on 01/14/2020. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/grr.
